reasoning: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism (central hypogonadism) is a specific subtype with estimated incidence 2-3 per 100k. Prevalence around 8 per 100k based on hormone replacement therapy usage patterns. Limited epidemiological data available.
source: Dandona P, Rosenberg MT. (2010). A practical guide to male hypogonadism in the primary care setting. Int J Clin Pract. 64(6):682-696
